The action is in the front, not in  the back. Bring 'em up front.
All right, I will, I will.
Listen to me very carefully. There  are three ways of doing things around  here. The right way, the wrong way,  and the way I do it. You understand?
I do understand that. I'll get right  on it. And thank you.
Don't thank me, just do it. You're  the Slots Manager. I shouldn't have  to tell you this.
Dang, you are right, Mr Rothstein, I  am so sorry.
GINGER follows a snooty MAITRE D' to JENNIFER, already se at a table.
So, I ended up workin' what? Eighteen- hour days?  Ginger was the one who  wound up enjoying the best of Vegas.
(To JENNIFER) Come with me, please. I have a better  table for you.  Sorry. He shows the two of them to the best table in the place.
(Sitting down next to
So, what'd you say to that fuckin'  jerk anyway?
(Smiling) I told him I was Mrs Sam Rothstein.
(Chuckles) Well, you might as well get somethin'  out of it. GINGER lights a cigarette.
Wide overhead of roadhouse cafe isolated in the middle of the desert with a sign out front that reads '60 miles to  Vegas'.

Well, it wasn't long before what I  was afraid was gonna happen, happened.  Nicky managed to get himself banned  from every casino in Las Vegas, and  from then on, I couldn't be seen  talkin' to him anywhere in Vegas, or  even near it.
(From inside the diner) What the fuck is that supposed to  mean?
ACE and NICKY are seated at a table in the empty diner.

(Reading from a  document) ' ...detrimental to gaming. And he  will be ejected from any casino in  Las Vegas...  and the casinos can be  fined as much as a hundred thousand  every time he shows up.' (He waves the document.) Do you believe this shit?
(Smoking a cigarette) Yeah, I believe it. You got banned. NICKY hisses.
(Reading) 'Who is of notorious and unsavory  reputation...' He angrily wads the document and tosses it across the tab
Motherfucker.  Unsavory fuckin'...  Is there any way around this?
Nope, there's no way.
Let's say... for instance... I want  to go in the restaurant which happens  to be in the casino... to get one of  those sandwiches I like?
Forget it. You can't even set foot  in the parking lot. That's how serious  it is.
In other words, I'm fucked.
In so many words, yes.

It just didn't sink into his head  about the Black Book and what it  meant. Not being able to go into a  casino is just one thing, but being  in this book etched your name into  the brains of every cop and FBI agent  in the state. I mean, you're listed  in there with Al Capone. But Nicky  didn't care.
I gotta do somethin'. I gotta do  somethin'. They ain't gettin' rid of  me. They're not gettin' rid of me.  I'm staying here. Fuck 'em. Fuck  'em.

head_text.subj: WE MOVE PAST THE SKULL OF A STEER MOUNTED ON AN EXTERIOR
WALL AND A WOODEN CIGAR STORE INDIAN STATUE, TO REVEAL
AND MARINO WHO ARE WAITING INSIDE THE GOLD RUSH. CAMERA C

text: So, once they pulled that shit, I  started doin' my own things in Vegas  nobody ever thought of doin'. To  keep an eye on things, I brought in  my kid brother Dominick... and some  desperadoes from back home and started  knockin' over high rollers, casino  bosses, bookmakers, anybody, right  here in town. I had a good fuckin'  crew goin' for me, I'll tell you  that. SAL FUSCO, JACK HARDY and BERNIE BLUE are getting out of car and walking into the jewelry store which is designed replicate an old-fashioned Western town with peaked roofs wooden planked sidewalks and hitching posts. The camera t by each man as they're introduced.

I had Sal Fusco, a great second-story  guy. Jack Hardy, he worked for a  safe company after he did a six-year  bit. And then there was Bernie Blue.  This guy could bypass any alarm for  me. And I opened up my own jewelry  store, too: 'The Gold Rush'.
NICKY places some jewelry from a vanity table into a sack and turns over some family photos. MARINO and HARDY are  struggling with a safe.
Sometimes I used to go along on a  heist just for the fun of it. But I  didn't like the people I was rippin'  off lookin' at me, so I used to turn  their fuckin' pictures around.
(To MARINO and HARDY) What's takin' so long over there?
This peter's a motherfucker.
(Grunting) It's workin'. Just keep workin' it.  It's comin'.
Gotta learn how to open these fuckin'  things so you won't have to take  'em.
NICKY is looking at diamonds with MARINO, HARDY and BLUE.
Frankie, some of these stones got a  lot of niggers in 'em. ZOOM IN TIGHT ON A DIAMOND.
Tell that fuckin' Pepe if he's  switching stones on us, he'd better  take a fuckin' camel - Phone rings.
- back to (picking up phone) Nigeria. (Into telephone) Yeah.
(Over telephone) Listen...
(Talking quietly into  telephone) ...they're in Penthouse K.
(Into telephone) They check in alone?
(Into telephone) They checked in alone.
(Into telephone) Are they out now?
(Into telephone) Yes, don't worry.
(Over telephone) All right.
(Into telephone) Thanks. He hangs up.
He had tipsters...
We see some luggage on the floor. A BELLMAN is on the pho with MARINO.
...all over town. Bellmen.
(Into telephone) This one looks good.  But you got to hurry.
(Over telephone) Yeah...
(Into telephone) ...yeah, okay. He hangs up.
A VALET PARKER standing outside a casino.
Valet parkers.
(Into telephone) They're just checking in now.
(Into telephone, seated  on a couch) Okay, I'll tell him.
A PIT BOSS is on the phone.
Pit bosses.
(Into telephone) Yeah, room twelve-thirty, at the  Sirocco.
(Into telephone) Twelve-thirty, right.
A SECRETARY seated at a desk.
Secretaries.
(Into telephone) It's all in mint condition coins.
(Into telephone) Mint condition. All right.
And they all...
HARDY and a hood are in a van parked in front of a wareho next door to a jewelry store.
...got a piece of the score.

(From inside the van,  into a walkie-talkie) Car's comin'. We move past the van to a larger truck parked in an alley Unseen, the truck has an open side door abutting the jewe store's wall. SAL FUSCO and BERNIE BLUE are inside the tr drilling into the wall using a heavy-duty battery-powered drill. The drill is muffled with sheets of insulation  material.

They were always very careful. And  they always bypassed the alarms, or  else... if not, they'd drill enough  holes to knock through the walls  with a sledgehammer... BLUE widens the hole with a hammer muffled with insulatio
A flashbulb explodes. Cops and detectives are photographing and inspecting hole drilled in the wall of the shop, through which the thieve have come and gone. The camera moves in through the hole.
Nobody out there was expecting a guy  like him.
The stunned STORE OWNER looks at the rubble and the empty jewelry boxes. Detectives collect evidence.
For Nicky, Las Vegas was the fuckin'  Wild West.
(Leading a detective  to his showroom) I just got a shipment of diamonds  from Israel...
But what the fuck they expect from  me? I had to earn, didn't I?
MARINO stands above two IRANIANS who are looking at the s gems.
You know, this diamond has flaws in  it.
No, no, there's no flaws in it.
Don't tell me. I'm doing this for  twenty-five years.
You better clean your fuckin' loupe.  'Cause there's no flaws in these  diamonds. The two IRANIANS speak to each other in Farsi.
Whenever we got local merch, we'd  usually send it to Palm Spring or  Arizona... LA. I had a couple of  sand niggers out there. You know,  Arabs.
What, are you gonna have a fuckin'  meeting here, or are you gonna buy  some diamonds?
(Chuckling) No, no. I know his language. I'm  talking with him.
Forty thousand dollars, you can buy  the whole package.
Twenty thousand, and that's my final  offer and...
(To IRANIAN #2) All of a sudden he talks English,  now. (To IRANIAN #1.) Let's talk turkey here, how 'bout  twenty-five thousand? IRANIAN #1 laughs.
NICKY and MARINO sneak into the house past JENNIFER who i asleep on the sofa in front of a TV set. NICKY takes out key and opens the metal door into his bedroom.
I actually turned my bedroom into a  bank vault where I kept the choice  stuff.
(Referring to JENNIFER  as they pass the  kitchen) She asleep?
Every night, on the couch.
I couldn't leave it at the Gold Rush  in case we got raided by the cops...  or if my crew got cute. Opening the metal door to his bedroom.
I had the only key.
Camera pans across bedroom to closet door.

Jennifer didn't give a fuck. She  used to fall asleep on the couch  watchin' television every night.  This stuff was all mine. I didn't  send any of this back home. NICKY opens the closet door. He and MARINO walk in and be down to lift up a small square of carpet to reveal a floo safe.

Actually, I couldn't because I wasn't  even supposed to be doin' it. The  bosses were makin' so much fuckin'  money with the casinos (unlocking the safe) that they didn't want anybody makin'  any waves for them. In the floor safe, there are several handguns and silence FRANK hands NICKY a roll of money.
Give all the guys in your crew a  piece of that?
I took care of everybody.
Yeah?   He searches MARINO's jacket.
That's why there was no real organized  street stuff in Vegas before I came  here. NICKY throws the cash in the safe and closes the lid.
NICKY is being shown papers by CHARLIE CLARK, a heavy-set banker with a moustache. They're both seated at a table i the living-room.
Yeah, that works out.
But how much cash could I bury in my  closet, right?
You need to understand, and I - I'm  sure you do... that in a venture of  this kind, you have to be prepared  to take some kind of loss.
Oh, listen, I understand that there's  always a risk... you know, I might  have to take a loss somewhere.
So I put some of the money into  legitimate deals with Charlie Clark.  He was Ace's banker.
I mean, you will try to push it  through, won't you, Mr Clark?
Yes.
Well, you gotta understand, I'm giving  you fifty thousand cash. CHARLIE CLARK chuckles
Then I put some more of the money...
A prosciutto sandwich is being prepared on a kitchen coun
...in some legitimate places, like  my restaurant.
(To COOK preparing  sandwich) Is that the last one?
Yeah. He hands the sandwich to DOMINICK who spits in it.
I had my kid brother, Dominick, run  it for me.
(Spits) Fuckers! DOMINICK wraps it in plastic and puts it into a brown pap bag.
DOMINICK sets the bag with the wrapped sandwich in it on of pizza boxes being held by two uniformed Vegas COPS.
Here you go, guys.
All right. Thanks, a lot.
Yeah... yeah, enjoy.
Yeah. He shakes COP #2's hand before heading back into the  restaurant.
Have a good time. (Muttering to himself.) Choke on it, ya motherfucker!
(Passing DOMINICK on  his way out) Hey, Dom.
Hey, how you doin'? DOMINICK walks over to some patrons in the bar area. NICK enters, kissing his brother.
Yeah, Nicky loved restaurants. He  was a real restaurant buff. And over  the years, he always made money with  them.
(Looking at one of  the patrons) Hey, Rich.

head_text.subj: THE CAMERA FOLLOWS NICKY AROUND THE RESTAURANT PAST LAS V

text: In Vegas, he had The Leaning Tower.  It was a very popular spot. He had  politicians, showgirls and movies  stars hangin' out all over the place. NICKY walks up to STEVE ALLEN and JAYNE MEADOWS seated at table, he whistles their theme tune as he approaches from behind.
Listen, that show over at the Flamingo  gets better and better.
By the way, Sammy said whenever you  have a minute, give him a call.
Made a messenger out of you too,  huh?
(Laughs) I'll do anything for a buck.
He does it. He does it to everybody.  Enjoy your dinner.
(Chuckles) Thanks.
Okay, thanks.

But I gotta tell you, the thing Nicky  liked the most was the showgirls,  naturally. I mean, to them, Nicky  was the movie star. NICKY walks across the room to MARINO and two showgirls,  SHELLY and STACY.
(To MARINO) You walk past me?
Hey. This is Shelly.
Hey, Shelly. (Kisses her hand.)
Hi.
How are you? Nice to meet you.
(Pointing to STACY) And this is Stacy.
Stacy. (Kisses her hand.)
(To the SHOWGIRLS) This is Nick.
Pleasure.
Hi, Nick.
We're gonna have dinner. Come on.
All right, uh, (To SHELLY) Let's just check the kitchen first.  Excuse us one second. Come on, I'll  show you. He takes SHELLY's hand and leads her out.
(From following scene) 'Cause I fly stuff in fresh every  day.
NICKY and SHELLY walk across the parking lot and get into his two-tone, red and white car.

I get bread from back home. I get  fish from California. And you can  always tell a great kitchen like  ours because of the milk-fed veal.  That's the secret. Opening the car door from the passenger's side, she gets
See, milk-fed veal is pure white.  Out here, they got that pink veal.  Slide over, honey. She slides over, he gets into the passenger's seat and cl the door.
Now, pink veal, you can pound that  shit for two days and it'll never  get tender, you know what I mean? SHELLY's head disappears into NICKY's lap.
FRANK and DOMINICK are at the bar watching as NICKY chast AL, a gambler. The restaurant is empty except for a waite milling around in the background, setting a few tables.
When I left here with the money...
Mm.
...I got muscled on the street.
Mm.
A couple of guys, I owe them. So,  that's what I did. I gave 'em the  money.  That's what I did.
Yeah?
Yeah.

You call yourself a man? You know  you're a lyin', low-life,  motherfuckin' gambling degenerate  prick? You know that's what you are?   Two small kids at home. I gave you  money to pay the fuckin' rent and  buy groceries, put the heat on. You  know your wife called Frankie and  told him the fuckin' heat's off? AL glances over to MARINO.
Huh? And you didn't gamble that  fuckin' money? You're gonna stand  here and tell me that? He shakes his head 'no'.
No, no? You didn't?
I didn't give 'em the m-

Don't fuck with me, Al! Don't make a  fuck out of me! You want to embarrass  me and make a fool out of me?!  You  didn't gamble?! Tell me you gambled  the fuckin' money, I'll give you the  fuckin' money to put the fuckin'  heat on! Did you gamble?! Huh?! The chastised gambler nods 'yes', bowing his head in sham
Fuckin' degenerate, you. NICKY takes some money from his coat pocket and starts  counting out some bills.
Fuckin' kids at home!  Here. (Giving him the money.) Get the fuck out of here.
Thanks, Nick.
Yeah, thanks. AL walks out.
Let me find out you fucked up, I'll  leave you wherever I find you.
NICKY, worn out from the night before, is making pancakes for LITTLE NICKY.
(To LITTLE NICKY) How many of these you gonna eat,  huh?
Two.
Two?
But around six-thirty in the morning  when he finished his day - NICKY hugs and kisses his son.
- no matter where he was or what he  was doing, he always went home to  make breakfast for his son, Nicky- Boy.
(Pouring some syrup  on his son's pancakes) Here, let's put a little of this on  for you. I know you like this. A  little butter, right, not a lot?
Mm-hm.
You know why, right?
Yeah.
Why?
'Cause it clogs up your heart.
What a smart kid you are! (Kisses him.) Okay, eat.
MARINO walks through an office past a few hoods.
Every couple of weeks I used to send  Marino back to the bosses with a  piece of what I made.
MARINO walks out of the office and through the garage.
Not a big piece, but fuck them, what  did they know? They were fifteen  hundred miles away...
Wide shot of gas station. There is snow on the ground. Th cloudy, Midwestern skyline of warehouses and skyscrapers be seen behind the gas station sign: 'All-American Gas'.
...and I don't know anybody who can  see that far. Their drop was a truck  stop/garage where...

location: ALL-AMERICAN GAS STATION, GAGGI'S BACK OFFICE

text: REMO GAGGI is seated in a chair as MARINO walks in. CURLY one of Gaggi's men, and two of the bosses are there.
...Remo and the guys used to hang  out and count their millions.
Remo. He bends down and kisses him.
Hey, Frankie.
How are you?
Fine, fine.
I mean, the cops knew, but they didn't  give a fuck. I mean, you know, they  all worked it out together.
Nicky sends his warmest regards. MARINO unzips a small sack and hands GAGGI a thick stack cash. GAGGI inspects it before handing it over to one of men.
Uh-huh. Good.
But I knew how to keep the bosses  happy. Whenever they gave me little  jobs to do, you know, to send a  message, I would carry things out...
And how are things going down there?
Fine. Everything's goin' good.
...to a tee. Like the time Tony  Dogs...
Flash cut of TONY DOGS and two men shooting up a bar with automatics hitting the owner, bartenders and a waitress.

...who was supposed to be the new  maniac tough guy in town, shot up  one of Remo's bars. Here's a fuckin'  guy, kills two of Remo's guys and a  poor fuckin' waitress, who was just  workin' on her night off, of all  things. SLOW MOTION ON TONY DOGS.
I mean, this guy's just beggin' to  be made an example of. The men and the waitress lie dead on the floor. The bar i left in shambles.
(From his office) Frankie...

location: ALL-AMERICAN GAS STATION, GAGGI'S BACK OFFICE

text: An enraged GAGGI gives MARINO orders.
...I want all the names of all the  other people he had with him. And I  don't care what you have to do to  him to get 'em. You understand?
I'll take care of it, Remo.
E mo va! [Italian-American slang for  'Now, go!']
MARINO and BLUE are dragging TONY DOGS, who is beaten to pulp, across the floor towards a workshop table. NICKY fo them.
To be truthful with you, I had to  admire this fuckin' guy.  He was one  of the toughest Irishmen I ever met.
This fuckin' guy, he got some stamina,  don't he?
This son-of-a-bitch was tough.
Personally, I don't give a fuck who  was with him anyway. As long as he  gives me a name I could give to them.
For two days and two fuckin' nights,  we beat the shit out of this guy. I  mean, we even stuck ice-picks in his  balls.
You better hope he gives me a fuckin'  name soon, or I'm gonna give him  yours, Frank. MARINO and BLUE lay DOGS on the table and put his head in vise. They're exhausted from beating him.
(To NICKY) Yeah, thanks a lot.
But he never talked.
(To MARINO) I know you would have ratted by now.
In the end, I had to put his fuckin'  head in a vise.
Dogs. Dogs, can your hear me, Dogs? DOGS gasps and mumbles.

Listen to me, Anthony. I got your  head in a fuckin' vise. I'm gonna  squash your fuckin' head like a  grapefruit if you don't give me a  name. Don't make me have to do this,  please. Come on. Don't make me be a  bad guy. Come on.
(With what strength  he as left) Fuck you!
(To MARINO and BLUE) This motherfucker, do you believe  this? Two fuckin' days and nights! (To DOGS.) Fuck me? NICKY begins to tighten the vise.
Fuck me, you motherfucker? (Turning the vise.) Fuck my mother? That's what you  fuckin' tell me? NICKY angrily keeps spinning the vise handle until sudden one of DOGS's eyes bulges out of the socket.
Huh? You motherfucker, you, huh? MARINO and BLUE are horrified by the sight. Everybody fre
Oh, God! Give me the fuckin' name!
Ch-Charlie M!
Charlie M?
(Blood streaming out  of his mouth) Charlie M.
(Screaming) Charlie M? You make me pop your  fuckin' eye out of your head to  protect that piece of shit? Charlie  M? You dumb motherfucker!
(Pleading) Kill me, you fuck, kill me.
Kill you, (unwinds the crank) You motherfucker you! (To MARINO.) Frankie, do him a fuckin' favor.
The word got around that finally... MARINO places a knife against DOGS's neck.
...there was a real gangster in town.  Nicky was the new boss of Las Vegas. We hear DOGS gasp as the knife slices his throat.
Charlie M!

Extreme close-up of a slot-machine. Four reels with seven across. Suddenly, the power goes out. Lights die down..  Machine 'waaaooows' down to a dead stop. Security guards, on their hands and knees, are pulling th plugs on the three giant $15,000 progressive machines, as ACE talks to DON WARD.
Four reels, sevens across, three  fifteen-thousand-dollar jackpots? Do  you have any idea what the odds are?
Shoot, it's gotta be in the millions,  maybe more.
Three fuckin' jackpots in twenty  minutes? Why didn't you pull the  machines? Why didn't you call me?
Well, it happened so quick. Three  guys won. I didn't have a chance to  call you.
You didn't see the scam? You didn't  see what was goin' on?
Well, there's no way to determine  that, Sam.
Yes, there is. An infallible way!  They won!
Well, it's a casino. People gotta  win sometimes.

Hey... Ward, you're pissin' me off.  Now, you're insulting my intelligence.  What do you think, I'm a fuckin'  idiot? You know goddamn well somebody  had to get into those machines and  set those fuckin' reels. SHERBERT enters, stands next to ACE.

The probability on one-four-reel  machine is a million and a half to  one. On three machines in a row,  it's in the billions.  It cannot  happen... would not happen, you  fuckin' momo! What's the matter with  you!  Didn't you see you were bein'  set up on the second win?
I really think you're -
(Interrupts) You - Wait! You didn't see that you  were being set up on the second win?
I really think you're overreacting  in this whole -
(Interrupts) Listen, you fuckin' yokel, I've had  it with you. I've been carryin' your  ass in this place ever since I got  here. Get your ass and get your things  and get out of here.
You're firin' me?
I'm firin' you? No, I'm not firin' (mocking WARD) I'm firin' you, you - Gives SHERBERT a look.
You might regret this, Mr Rothstein.
I'll regret it even more if I keep  you on.
This is not the way to treat people.

Listen, if you didn't know you're  bein' scammed, you're too fuckin'  dumb to keep this job. If you did  know, you were in on it. Either way,  you're out!  Get out! Go on. (To SHERBERT.) Let's go. ACE and SHERBERT walk off, WARD turns to leave.
ACE and GREEN are seated having coffee and muffins in the Hawaiian lounge by the casino floor.
I mean, the guy is history as far as  I'm concerned. History.
But you can't just fire him. Webb's  his brother-in-law. He's County  Commissioner.
So what? Everybody out here with  cowboy boots is a fuckin' county  commissioner or related to a county  commissioner. I'm fuckin' sick of  it.
This is his state. His uncle's Chief  Judge. His brother-in-law runs the  County Commission. I don't know how  many other relatives he's got in  town.  There's gotta be a way to  work him back in.

Phil, I can understand. You're in  the finances, you're upstairs, but  you are not on the floor. I got  thousands of players. I got five  hundred dealers.  They're all lookin'  to rob me blind, twenty-four hours a  day. I have to let them know I'm  watching all the details, all the  time; that there is not one single  thing I will not catch as I am over  here. Breaks open his blueberry muffin, puts it down and points Green's.
Look at yours.
What?
Look at that. Look at this. There's  nothin'... look how many blueberries  your muffin has and how many mine  has. Yours is falling apart. I have  nothing.
What are you talking about?
It's like everything else in this  place. You don't do it yourself, it  never gets done. GREEN follows ACE to the kitchen.
Where you goin'?
ACE, GREEN and the BAKER are gathered around the BAKER's  counter surrounded by muffin tins and batter.
(Handing the BAKER  the two muffins) From now on I want you to put an  equal amount of blueberries in each  muffin. An equal amount of blueberries  in each muffin.
You know how long that's going to  take?
I don't care how long it takes. Put  an equal amount in each muffin. ACE leaves, GREEN looks on in amazement as the BAKER hold the muffins. GREEN follows ACE out.
ACE, seated at the kitchen table, is feeding AMY in a hig chair. The nanny is in the background.
Come on, honey, just a little. That  a girl, that a girl. Oh, boy, look. GINGER enters and goes to the sink.
(To AMY, who is sobbing  and mumbling) Okay, want to go with Mommy?
What do you need?
(Giving AMY to the
You get her?  Okay. (To ACE.) Well, I need a lot. I need more than  usual.
Well, why don't you take it out of  your account? There's a lot there.
Well, I would, you know, Sam. It's  just that... well, I need more than  that. I need twenty-five thousand. She sits down at the table next to him.
Twenty-five thousand? For yourself?
(Picking up an empty  carton of milk) Yeah.
Why do you need that much?
Well, what's the difference? I just  need it.
Well, I mean... you know, I gotta  ask you. That's a lot of money.   You're not asking for a box of  popcorn, you know. I mean...

I'm aware of that. We don't have to  turn this into a big deal. (Getting up to the  refrigerator.) Okay? We don't have to have a fight.  It was important to me. But forget  it. Just something I wanted to do  for myself.
Who's fighting? I mean, I'm, you  know, tell me what it's for. GINGER, annoyed, closes the refrigerator door.
Why can't you tell me what it's for? She stirs her coffee.
Huh? (Pause) Well, you know what? Now, I want you  to tell me. I mean, my wife comes to  me and asks me for twenty-five  thousand. I mean, what do you want?  Do you want a coat?
No.
Well, if you want a coat, you got  it. You know that. It's not the money,  it's just why do you want it?  That's  all I'm askin'. Am I not entitled to  that?
Look - Sam, I've been independent my  whole life. I never had to ask anybody  for anything. Now you're making me  beg you for this.
What are you talkin' a- ?
(Interrupting) Okay? And you're embarrassing me.  Why do want to make me feel so bad?

You're askin' me for twenty-five  thousand. I'm not out to make you  feel bad. I want to just be able to  trust you. You now, it's about trust.  I have to be able to trust you with  my life. Do you understand? Can I  trust you? (She doesn't answer.) Can I trust you?... Can I trust  you?... Answer me. Can I trust you?
(Quietly) You can trust me.
Good, so then you could tell me what  the money is for. GINGER gives him a look and leaves.
GINGER takes about two inches of $100 bills out of a safe deposit box and slips it in an envelope.
NICKY is on a phone watching GINGER leave the bank.
(Into telephone) Yeah, she's leavin' the bank now.  All right, I'm gonna follow her. (He hangs up.)
GINGER is in a booth with LESTER DIAMOND, handing him the envelope filled with money.
What does that mean? No, I know that  look. What does that mean?
It means I got the money.
You got money. That's a - That's a  good look.

head_text.subj: ACE ENTERING, FOLLOWED BY A HOOD. HE SITS DO
AT THE BOOTH WITH LESTER AND GINGER.

text: How you doin', Les? It's Lester,  right? Sam. Extends his hand to LESTER, who shakes it.
From my recollection, aren't you the  card shark... the golf hustler...   the pimp from Beverly Hills? LESTER gives GINGER a 'how did you fuck this up?' Look.

If I'm wrong, please correct me,  'cause I never knew you to be a heist  man. (LESTER sighs.) But if you are, you know what...  here, take mine too. ACE takes some money out of his coat and puts the thick w of bills on the table.
Go ahead, take it. 'Cause you already  have hers. LESTER turns and sees two HOODS standing by the front and back doors of the diner.
She's my wife. (To LESTER.) Look at me. You did know that, didn't  you? You knew that she's my wife?  Huh? Hey, look at me.
Yeah, yeah. I know that.

You do? Yeah? Well, if you ever come  back again... ever... to take her  money... next time bring a pistol.   That way you got a chance. Be a man,  don't be a fuckin' pimp. Now, you  want to do me a favor? Get out of  here. I want to be alone with my  wife. Get the fuck up and get out of  here. After stammering for a moment, LESTER gets up and begins move towards the back door.
(Quietly) Okay.
You fuckin' piece of shit.
Hey, that's just fuckin' - That's  bullshit. You know, you know, what  the fuck? The thugs follow him out of the back door. GINGER freezes
You remember when you called him  that night? When you said goodbye to  him?  He didn't say, 'Don't get  married, I'll be right down, we'll  get married.'  He didn't say that to  you, did he?
(Whispering) No, he didn't.

If you're  actin' like this now, how can I depend  on you?  There's a lot of things  gonna change out here. And if you  wanna be there with me, Sammy, you're  gonna have to go my fuckin' way.

Listen, Nick, you gotta understand  my situation. I'm responsible for  thousands of people. I got a hundred  million a year goin' through the  place.  It's all over, I'm gonna  tell you, it's all over, if I don't  get that license.  And believe me,  if it goes bad for me, it's gonna go  bad for a lot of people, you  understand?

Yeah, forget about your fuckin'  license. I plant my own flag out  here, you ain't gonna need a fuckin'  license. (Pause.) You know, I don't know what it is,  Sammy, but the more I talk to you,  the more I feel like you just don't  wanna go along with me, is that it?
No, I don't wanna come -
You should say so.
I don't wanna come along with you.
Just say so.
I'll be honest with you.
All right, fine.
I don't wanna be involved in anything  you're talkin' about...
Fine. NICKY walks to a table and flips through Business Week  magazine.
...okay? I just wanna run a square  joint. That's it. I just want my  license. I want everything nice and  quiet. That's it.
(Holding up the  magazine) You mean, quiet like this: 'I'm the  boss.'  That's quiet?
That's all taken out of context.  Okay.
Yeah, that's out of context. Okay.
I have no control over that. Ronnie  and Billy were right there. They'll  tell you exactly what happened.
Well, back home they don't know about  fuckin' control. That looks bad.
Looks bad? I'm gonna tell you what  looks bad.
Yeah?
Every time you're on television I  get mentioned. That looks bad. That  looks bad.
What the fuck happened to you? Will  you tell me?
What happened to me? What happened  to you?
Yeah.
You lost your control.
I lost control?
Yes, you lost your control.
Look at you. You're fuckin' walkin'  around like John Barrymore.
All right.
A fuckin' pink robe and a fuckin'...
All right.
...uh, uh, cigarette holder. I'm - I  lost control?!
Yeah.
You know, I didn't want to bring  this up, but you have treating a lot  of people with a lot of disrespect.  Even your own wife.
My wife?
Yeah.
Now, what does she have to do with  all this?
Well, she comes to see me. She was  upset about a lot of things,  especially that whole fuckin' Diamond -  that Lester Diamond incident.
All of a sudden, you're the shoulder  to cry on? Did you at least tell her  about your little role in that whole  situation?
No, I didn't. What good would that  do? That's not the fuckin' point.
Listen, I would -
(Interrupting) The point is that she's upset. She's -  and you got a fuckin' problem.
I - I would appreciate it if you'd  stay out of my personal life, okay?   You wouldn't like it if I did it to  you.
Hey, she came to talk...
Please...
...to me.
...don't do it to me...
She came to talk to me...
Okay?
And I - what was I supposed to do,  throw her out?
Ju-just stay away from her. It's  none of your business, okay? There  are certain things you don't do, and  you know that.
It's none of my business?
That's right, yeah.
A week ago it was my business, now  it's none of my business. In other  words, when you need me to take care  of somethin' for you, then you need  me.

Yeah, that's right, the way you need  me to vouch for you as a citizen and  get you out of one of your jams. I'm  gonna have to straighten out what  you just did with this guy. NICKY starts to walk out.
This guy is gonna run to the FBI.
Your fuckin' head is getting' bigger  than your casino. That's your problem,  pal.
I knew what he wanted, and I didn't  want any part of it.
(Walking to the glass  doors leaving ACE  standing there) Fuckin' walking around with a big  head. You better check yourself...
Nicky wanted to take over. He wanted  to go after Gaggi, go after the skim,  go after everything and everybody. NICKY shuts the door behind him and walks down the stairs the golf course.
Plus, he had stopped askin' permission  from back home for every little thing.

head_text.subj: CHEST. COPS AND PRESS ARE MILLING AROUND.
CAMERA SPIRALS OUT FROM THE BODIES OF A CASINO EXECUTIVE
HIS WIFE WHO HAVE BEEN GUNNED DOWN ON THEIR FRONT LAWN.

text: A casino boss and his wife were  killed. The bulls questioned Nicky.
Police photographers taking pictures of a dealer, dead be the wheel of his car, his eyes and mouth frozen wide open a silent scream.
A dealer from the Sirocco... they  questioned Nicky.
Two policemen open the trunk of a car and find a trussed- dead body. They cover their noses because of the stench.
A bunch of stool pigeons wound in  the trunks of their cars... they  questioned Nicky.
We see a brand-new car explode.
A lawyer... they questioned Nicky.
A front door where a pile of newspapers have accumulated. Another newspaper is thrown at the door.
And when some guys who didn't pay  their Shylocks began disappearing,  Nicky's name was in every one of  those newspapers.

NICKY and OSCAR GOODMAN, his lawyer, leave the court-hous surrounded by reporters and photographers. They wait at t curb for the light and NICKY, smiling, politely cautions photographer to be careful of the on-coming traffic.
Nicky was questioned in two dozen  murders, but they always had to let  him go. There were never any  witnesses.
The coppers blamed me for everything  that went wrong out here, and I mean  every little fuckin' thing too.
(To photographer) Watch yourself. You're gonna get  runned over there.
If a guy fuckin' tripped over a  fuckin' banana peel, they'd bring me  in for it.
(To reporters) Come on, huh. That's enough now. Be  nice, huh? Be nice.

location: ALL-AMERICAN GAS STATION, GAGGI'S BACK OFFICE, BACK

text: MARINO walks through a doorway to GAGGI's office. CURLY p him on the back. He shakes BEEPER's hand, then FORLANO's, who is on the phone.

And the bosses were no better. I  mean, they complained day and night  because things don't run smooth.  Well, in my line of work, things  don't run so smooth, I'm sorry. I  mean, I'm dealing with degenerate  animals out here. But the bosses,  what do they give a fuck? They're  sittin' on their asses, drinkin'  anisette. Meanwhile, I'm the guy in  the trenches. Fuckin' bosses, they  think it's a fuckin' free lunch out  here. MARINO hands a brown-paper bag filled with $100 bills to  GAGGI.
(Ignoring the money) Frankie... they found a guy's head  in the desert. Do you know about  that?
Yeah, I heard, yeah.
Yeah. Everybody's talkin' about it.  They're makin' a big deal out of it.
I know.
It's in all the papers.
What're you gonna do?
And I mean... that's no good.
I know.
You gotta tell him... to take care  of things a little better.
I'll tell him, Remo.
Fuckin'...
NICKY is talking quietly to MARINO. They are surrounded b people waiting for the bus.

...bosses. I mean, they're smokin'  their Di Nobilis and they're eatin'  a trippa [Italian-American slang for  'tripe'.] and fuckin' suffritt', you  know, fried pigs guts? While, if I  wanna talk private, I gotta go to a  fuckin' bus stop.
(To MARINO) But, hey, what do they care, as long  as I keep sendin' money back.
Yeah, but they're complaining.
Let 'em complain. I'm the one who's  here. The bus arrives, obscuring our view of them.
I do all the work. Somebody don't  like it, fuck him.
It's up to you.
They want a fuckin' war, I'm ready. When the bus departs it reveals NICKY and MARINO alone on the bench, talking.
I know one thing. All I gotta do is  take care of four or five of those  fuckin' guys, the rest will fall  right into place. Believe me.
NICKY is watching a police surveillance car with two agen through binoculars.
Peekaboo, you fucks, you.
I see you, you motherfuckers.
The problem was, Nicky was not only  bringin' heat on himself, but on me  too. The FBI watched every move he  made. But he didn't care. He just  didn't care.

head_text.subj: THE CAMERA MOVES PAST NICKY TO REVEAL MARINO, SEATED IN F
OF TV SECURITY MONITORS ON THE PARKING AREA IN FRONT AND

text: If they're gonna watch me, fuck 'em,  I'm gonna watch 'em right back. I  spent a few dollars. Top dollar, who  gives a shit? HARDY, seated next to MARINO, is adjusting a knob on one the may police radio scanners. There are a couple of came on the table next to him. A debugging expert is going over the walls with a metal  detector.

I got the latest anti-buggin'  equipment from the same places that  sell to the fuckin' CIA. I had all  the special police frequency radios,  FBI descramblers, cameras that see  in the dark, and because of that,  the miserable sons-of-bitches that  they are, they never once caught me  doin' anything I couldn't handle. DOMINICK and FUSCO are at a table arguing.
I got my job...
NICKY swings a gold club. MARINO, and two men, are with h
...on the line and this guy's out  havin' the time of his life. He has  every cop in the state watchin' him,  and he's out playin' golf.
Practice enough this week, you prick?
And at the...
ACE is with the Control Board investigators AUSTIN and DU They are all pouring over legal files and record books ou on a table by the swimming pool.
...worst possible time for me.
A record of the arrests...
I had my license hearing coming up  and I didn't wanna leave anything to  chance.
That was nineteen years ago, and  they were simple gambling pinches.
I mean, if I can't work in Vegas,  where am I gonna go?
You've been very open with us. I  mean, uh, your books and papers and...   that - that's gonna mean something  when you go before the Commission.
Well, that's all I ask, gentlemen, a  fair hearing.
Well, this kind of honesty will  guarantee that fair hearing.
Good.
All right, well, we'll move on to - Suddenly a sputtering airplane flies right over Ace's hou
(As he looks at the  plane) I wanted to hear something about...   Kansas City.
(Looking at the  airplane) What the fuck is this? Where's this  fuckin' guy gonna land, on the  fairway?
ACE and the board investigators follow the plane as it la on the fairway. ACE has taken off his sunglasses to get a better look. Two men in suits get out.
(To MARINO) They're fuckin' agents, Frankie.  Look at this.
The AGENTS run across the golf course, past ACE and the  investigators, who look on open-mouthed.

The Feds were watchin' Nicky play  golf for so long, they ran out of  gas. Just what I needed. Right in  front on the Control Board. The agents run behind the hedges by ACE's pool. AUSTIN an DUPREY stare at ACE as if he had something to do with it.
A hundred dollars, whoever hits the  plane. NICKY, MARINO, and the other men swing their clubs.
(putting his sunglasses  back on) And, as if things weren't bad  enough...

location: SAN MARINO ITALIAN GROCERY, KANSAS CITY

text: ...in comes Piscano, the Kansas City  underboss. He ran that little grocery  store in Kansas City where they  brought the suitcases.
PISCANO and his MOTHER are at the counter of his elderly  BROTHER-IN-LAW's store.

They're fightin' over those suitcases  again. You know what that means,  right? You know what that means,  right? That means I gotta take another  trip out to Vegas, and it's gonna  cost me another couple of grand.
He ran it with his brother-in-law,  but mostly what he did was complain,  complain about his trips to Vegas,  to his brother-in-law and to his  mother, all the time.
(Seated) You gotta lay down the law. Otherwise  they're gonna make a fool out of  you.
They're not gonna make a fool out of  me. I write it all down in this book, (holding up a notepad) every fuckin' nickel that goes down.  Right here, receipts...
(Chastising her son) Hey! Oh!
Oh, sorry -
What's the matter with you?
Receipts and bills and... everything's  here.
Since when do you talk like that?
I'm sorry.
There's a lot of people here.
Nance gives me trouble and I'll tell  him... screw around with those  suitcases and I'll take the eyes out  of his frickin' head.
Again!
I didn't curse. I said 'frickin'  head'.
That's enough.
I'm sorry.
And what happens next?

head_text.subj: MICROPHONE AND TRANSMITTER AT ITS BASE.

text: You can't believe it. I mean, who  the hell would believe that the FBI  had a wire in the place lookin' for  some information about some old  homicide about some guy who was  whacked-out, God knows when, over  God knows what?
Plus, what's to prevent him with the  suitcases, that he can take what he  wants?  Fuckin' Nance, he brings us  back two suitcases from the Tangiers,  and what about three or four?

And sure he's got his people in there.  But how do you know? They could all  be in on it together, those miserable  fucks. His MOTHER reacts to his language.
I'll find out and, if it's Green  himself, I'll bury that bastard.

(Over transmitter) I've never trusted him. And you know  I got eyes...

All right, take it easy now, take it  easy.
Mom, I'm sorry, they're beatin' me  left and right. (Knocking down some  bottles of olive  oil.) Ma, I'm sorry. I'm all upset.
(Tapping the counter) I know, but that's enough.
You know - You know - You know what  they're doin' to me?
I know it, I know it.
I can't take this no more. Back and  forth, back and forth.
Take it easy, though.
All right, all right. But I - I -
You'll get a heart attack like that.
You know, I - I'm too upset right  now. And - An end has to be put to  this.
And the damn...

If I have to start handlin' things  the way I...

(Over transmitter) ...did years ago, start kickin' ass,  I - I'll do it, and I'll use the  goddamn shovel!  I mean, I... We see an agent looking out of the window with a pair of  binoculars.
(Over transmitter) You are right. The other agent, with headphones, is seated at a desk by tape recorder, writing.
(Over transmitter) ...everything's comin' out of my  pocket. I gotta pay for all these  trips back and forth, back and forth.
(Over transmitter) You are right. What can I...
(On tape recorder) ...tell you.

text: Would you believe that such a thing  could happen?
(On tape recorder) I'm in this to make money, not to  lose money.  And...
Every FBI man across the country had  their ears open now.
(On tape recorder) Because... The stenographer's pen writes: 'BORELLI' on a piece of pa
(On tape recorder) ...if you want somethin'... Stenographer writes: 'TANGIERS'.
(On tape recorder) ...done right, you gotta do it  yourself.
(On tape recorder) Then do it the way you want. Pen writes: 'VEGAS'.
(On tape recorder) What can I tell you?
I mean... Pen writes: 'SANTORO'.
...Piscano, this guy basically... The stenographer's pen taps twice on the word 'SANTORO'.
...sunk the whole world. Pen writes: 'SANTORO'. FOCUS ON STENOGRAPHER, LISTENING.
(On tape recorder) That's the way people are. There are  some that are good and some that are  bad.

location: GAMING CONTROL BOARD HEARING ROOM, LAS VEGAS 1980 -

text: ACE is in the court with OSCAR GOODMAN, his lawyer, facin the Control Board's Chairman and six COMMISSIONER MEMBERS The Chairman is the SENATOR we saw earlier in the casino  suite taking chips out of the bureau drawer. The room is packed: GREEN, GINGER, SHERBERT, as well as WEBB, reporte and other spectators. ACE's secretaries carry in legal pa There are piles of briefs and law books on OSCAR's and AC table.
Mr Chairman and members of the  Commission. Mr Rothstein is pleased  to be here today.
And when the day finally came, I was  ready. I felt so confident that all  I had to do was present my case.

...evidence... and we have documents,  one of which is a report by retired  FBI agents, which completely absolves (holding up a large  file folder) Mr Rothstein from any wrongdoing.  I'd like this marked, please, Mr  Chairman.
(Into microphone) Pardon me, counselor. Before you  continue...
No, I want to have this marked, Mr. -
(Into microphone) ...this, uh, this Commission is  prepared to act on a motion denying  the Rothstein application.
Denying?
(Into microphone) Do I hear a motion seconded?
Mr. Chairman -
(Into microphone) Mr. Chairman, I second the motion.
(Into microphone) Do I have a vote on the motion?
Mr. Chairman - The COMMISSIONERS quickly repeat:
(Into microphone) Aye.
(Into microphone) Aye.
(Into microphone) Aye.

(Into microphone) The ayes have it. This hearing is  adjourned. The CHAIRMAN bangs his gavel and prepares to leave. The  COMMISSIONERS hurriedly pack up their papers. An enraged rises and approaches the SENATOR.  TV CAMERAS ROLL.
(Getting up) You guys have to be kidding. The SENATOR picks up his briefcase.
Adjourned! What do you mean,  adjourned?
Mr. Chairman, please.
Mr. Chairman... The SENATOR picks up his folder.
Senator, you promised me a hearing. We see WEBB seated in the first row, watching.
You won't allow me a hearing? You  didn't even look at the FBI reports. A reporter holds a microphone up to the SENATOR.
When you were my guest, Mr. Chairman,  Senator, at the Tangiers Hotel, did  you not promise me that I would have  a fair hearing - The SENATOR bends down to a microphone.
(Interrupting, into  microphone) I was never - I was never your guest  at the Tangiers.
You were never my guest?!
(Into microphone) That's right.
I never comped you?! I don't comp  you at least two or three times a  month at the Tangiers?!
(Into microphone) Uh, I - I'd... I'd like to answer -  answer that at this time.
Liar.
(Into microphone) Mr Rothstein is being very typical  to this point.
He's lying. WEBB starts to leave.
The only time I was at the Tangiers  was when I had dinner with Barney  Greenstein.
Was I at that dinner? Just tell me -
You were wandering around.
Was I at that dinner?
You were wandering around.
Was I at that dinner?
You were wandering around.
Was I at that dinner?
You were in the m- You were in the  building.
I was in the building! GREEN, embarrassed by ACE's behaviour, starts to get up.
You know damn well I was at that  dinner, and you swore to me that I  would have a fair hearing at that  dinner! Did you not?! Did you not?! (Pause, ACE looks at
Well, tell me I was at least at the  dinner! A-allow me that much. (Pause.) Give me that much at least!
(Hesitates) Yes, you were. The SENATOR starts to walk out.
Yeah, thanks for not callin' me a  liar. You son-of-a-bitch. You son-of- a

Good evening, everyone, I'm Paige  Novodor. (On television.) What should have been a routine  licensing hearing turned into bedlam  yesterday when the flamboyant Tangiers  Casino executive, Sam ACE spots COMMISSIONER CARTER slipping out the door.
(Overlapping) ...'Ace' Rothstein, accused the  state's top gaming officials of  corruption.
(Overlapping) What are you running for, Bob? What  are you running for?
(Overlapping) ...and hypocrisy.

(Into two reporters'  microphones) Don't you remember? You promised me  a fair hearing when you were gettin'  comped at my hotel and you were asking  me for copies of your bills so - SHERBERT and GINGER look on.
- you could put 'em on your expense  account?
In a (on television) Wild and unprecedented outburst that  followed his gaming license (voice-over,  overlapping) denial, Rothstein followed several...
(With several  reporters, overlapping) Bullshit! Bullshit!
Putting on his sunglasses, ACE emerges from the courtroom with SHERBERT, GINGER, OSCAR and several reporters. He is surrounded by the press.
...stunned commissioners into the  hallway, where he continued his  harangue until his own lawyers and  friends urged him to leave.

(To COMMISSIONERS  standing in the  hallway, speaking  into a TV news  microphone) We all have a past. You have a past,  I have a past. And my past is no  worse than yours. But you guys think  you have the right to pass judgement  on me.
(Overlapping) Long suspected of running the Tangiers  without...
(Overlapping) ...twenty years in order to find  nothin' on me - OSCAR pulls him away, ACE looks back at the COMMISSIONERS
- unsubstantiated truths on me. And  if you look at your own lives you'd  all be in jail. OSCAR ushers ACE out, past WEBB and Gaming Investigator  AUSTIN.
(Overlapping) ...a gaming license, yesterday's  hearing was to determine whether  someone with Rothstein's checkered  personal history was qualified to  officially hold the top gaming post.

GAGGI hands STONE an issue of the Las Vegas Sun showing a photograph of ACE at the licensing hearing. Headline read 'Rothstein out of gaming: Control Board Rules against  Rothstein License Application'.
(from previous scene  continued) Fuckin' hypocrites! STONE stands beside GAGGI's car door. GAGGI is in the bac seat with his window down.
What the hell's he gonna do now?
I don't know (Sighs.)
What's he doin'? He knows all those  guys he yelled at are friends of  ours. What's the matter with him,  making all this mess?
Maybe he could run things with another  job title. Wouldn't be the best,  but, uh, what are we gonna do?

However he runs things, it's gotta  be quiet. Let him hide upstairs in  the office. Say he's the janitor, I  don't give a shit. But, please,  whatever job he takes, make sure  it's something quiet. STONE walks back to his car. Both cars pull out in opposi directions.
A video monitor shows a title card, reading: 'From the  Tangiers Hotel'. TRUDY, Ace's showgirl sidekick, is heard over the opening credit sequence of the show.
Ladies and gentlemen, the Tangiers  Hotel proudly presents the all-new  Sam Rothstein Show, Aces High.
The monitor shows a neon sign reading, 'Welcome to Fabulo Las Vegas, Nevada', then shows several gamblers at a crap table.

Tonight, taped live from the all-new  sportsbook, we present the premiere  showing of Aces High. With the... The video monitor shows a neon sign: 'Stardust', then ano 'Tangiers'. WE SEE TRUDY ON A STAGE.
(Into microphone) ...Sasha Semenoff Orchestra... THE CAMERA PANS TO SASHA SEMENOFF CONDUCTING HIS BAND.
...and the Sam Rothstein Dancers.
We see ACE greeting various guests in the audience as he  moves towards the stage.
Mr Rothstein is a professional gambler  and the best football handicapper... A video monitor shows a montage featuring showgirls, a ch carving beef and three women wearing bathing suits.
...in American, a man who will take  you inside the real Las Vegas as no  one has ever done before. And now,  ladies and gentlemen, the new... ACE joins TRUDY on the stage.

...Entertainment Director of the  Tangiers Hotel Casino: Mr Sam  Rothstein. ACE approaches his desk as TRUDY sits on a long sofa. The audience applauds. The band plays and the dancers complete their number.

(Seated at a desk a  la Johnny Carson) Welcome to the Sam Rothstein Show. We're very happy to have you here  this evening. The young lady to my  left is Trudy, who is a lead new  dancer in our fabulous show from  Paris. Audience applauds, she waves hello.

Our first guest this evening... is  Frankie Avalon. FRANKIE AVALON walks to the stage, embracing TRUDY and sh ACE's hand. Audience applauds. WEBB stands in the rear of the sportsbook/theater with AU and DUPREY, watching ACE.
Keep an eye on him. He exits.
...Well, I've got a large family.
(Into microphone) How many kids do you have?
(Into microphone) Uh, I'm very proud to say that we  have eight children.
(Into microphone) Eight children! (He encourages the  audience to applaud.)
(Into microphone) No, no, no, no, please, please,  please, please, no, please.
(Into microphone, to  audience) That's amazing.
(Into microphone) There was nothing to it. (Chuckles) It was my pleasure.
GREEN and ARTHUR CAPP are solemnly watching another episo of Ace's TV show with an elderly juggler guest.
Ace, don't do it. ACE begins to juggle.
Oh, no, no. No, no. Oh, Jesus...  he's juggling! The audience cheers him on.
(From next scene) Let's not take County Commissioner  Pat Webb too seriously.

head_text.subj: WE MOVE PAST TWO TELEVISION CAMERAS TO ACE BEHIND HIS DES
AT ANOTHER TAPING OF HIS SHOW. TRUDY IS AT HIS SIDE.

text: (Into microphone) I recently challenged him to a debate  on this program and he declined.  What are you worried about, Pat?   You don't have to send me any  questions. You can ask me anything  you want.
(From next scene) What the hell is he doin' on  television, anyway?

location: ALL-AMERICAN GAS STATION, GAGGI'S BACK OFFICE, BACK

text: Vegas Sun newspaper front page photo of ACE on television Headline reads: 'Rothstein Sues Gaming Commission'. STONE is sitting across from GAGGI at his office.

He's on all night, screamin' about  how he's gonna take his damn lawsuit  all the way to the Supreme Court. He  really must be crazy. He's gonna go  to Washington with this?  (Chuckles.) He's out of his fuckin' mind.
(From next scene) It's a pity in this...
(Into microphone) ...state that we have such hypocrisy.  Some people can do whatever they  want. Other people have to pay through  the nose.

location: ALL-AMERICAN GAS STATION, GAGGI'S BACK OFFICE, BACK

text: (From previous scene) But such is life.
Andy, go see him. Tell him maybe  it's time he should quit.

location: MIGHTY MART CONVENIENCE STORE, REAR PARKING LOT, LAS

text: SHERBERT and ACE pull up beside another parked car. ACE g out of his car in a robe and pajamas and gets into STONE' car.
First of all, what they did was  totally unconstitutional. We're  already on the list to be heard before  the Supreme Court of the United States  later this year.
These guys back home don't give a  fuck about the Supreme Court and any  of this bullshit! They want things  to quiet down. They want you to walk  away from -
Walk away? Andy, you can't be serious.  How can I walk away? Don't you see  what's goin' on here? Don't you see  what's at stake?
The old man said, 'Maybe your friend  should give in.'  And when the old  man says 'maybe', that's like a papal  bull. Not only should you quit, you  should run!

Know what my problem is? Every time  they mention my name in the papers,  these cocksuckers, they mention Nicky,  too. How the fuck does that help?  I  mean, the heat he brought down is  murder!  We had a police department  who was cooperative. He's pissed  them off so much now that nobody can  make a move anymore. I mean, what do  you do about that?
What do you propose?
I don't know, he doesn't listen to  me. Maybe he should...  get lost for  a while. Take a vacation. Would that  be so bad?
They ain't sendin' Nicky nowhere.
All right, look, if he took a break,  it would just give everybody some  time to maneuver. That's all I'm  saying. It's all that I'm saying.
I would forget about the maneuver. I  would just get out.
(Sighs) I can't do that.

You'll get your money! Don't worry. GINGER squats down and starts to gather her stuff.

(Tossing clothes) No kidding. NO KIDDING!

Love you?! She tosses a pair of red shoes at him.

You're lower than a dog!

(Shoving the bundles  of cash in her face) Here. Here. Is this enough money?!  Huh?  Will it last you two fuckin'  days? Take it, greedy bitch. (Stuffing the money  in her bag.) Take the fuckin' money you fuckin'  want.

I guarantee you, I will not stop  you.

Stop! You aren't getting rid of me  with one fuckin' suitcase!

Fine. (Sniffs, walking back.) I'm takin' Amy.
(Stopping her) You're not takin' Amy.
I am. I'm wakin' her up right now.
You're stoned. You're a junkie. Get  out of here. He opens the door and tosses her suitcase out.
I am not! She's my daughter too!  Goddamn you!
Get out of here! He shoves her out the door.
Send my lawyers a letter. (Slamming the door  behind her.) God-fuckin'-damn you! He locks the door, and peers through the peep-hole.
(Through the doors as  ACE walks away) You're not getting away with this!  You're not gonna fuck me out of my  end!
GINGER is furious. She picks up the suitcase and walks up her sportscar.
Fucker! (Sobs.) She drives off.

(Pause.) Okay? She nods silently. He looks at her and turns, leaving her alone in the kitchen.
A very large trailer is in the middle of an empty constru site. GINGER's and NICKY's cars are parked outside.
(From trailer) Well, what are you supposed to do? I  mean, what do you want to do?  Do  you want to stay the way you are?  You want to stay like this?  You  can't do that.
GINGER and NICKY are alone in the large trailer. They are sitting close together on a couch.
I mean, listen, two people don't get  along, at some point you gotta call  it... I mean, it's none of my  business, but I ... I think that's  what you gotta do. You gotta take it  somewhere -
(Smoking a cigarette) Oh, you're right, I know.  It's...  well, I was just -
What? What?
Nothin'.
What were you gonna say? Go ahead.
I don't - (Sighs.)
Tell me what you were gonna say. Go  ahead.
Yeah?
Yeah.

Well, I was thinkin', maybe... you  know somebody at the bank...  could  help me get my jewelry out?  There's  a lot of money in there. Lot of money  in there, and I'd be willing to take  care of anybody who helped me out.
(Pauses) Let me think about that.
Okay.
See who I got in there. Gotta get  somebody I can trust.
Mm-hm.
You know?
Yeah. 'Cause, you know, (leaning her head  back) He's never gonna give me my jewelry.
Hm.
He holds that key so tight, he's  probably got it stuck up his ass.
(Chuckles) Yeah, right. That's Sammy. And he's  probably got it there too. Takes a sip of his drink.
He's so fuckin' lucky. I could have  buried him. I could have gone to  Europe and taken the baby. And then  he'd've tracked me down and he'd've  killed me.

No, he wouldn't. I would have. (GINGER chuckles.) And he'd've been right, too. I mean,  seriously. (She cuddles closer  to him.) Well, there's one thing you don't  do. You don't take a guy's kid and  then take off.
(Quietly) I didn't. (Chuckles.) I didn't. I mean, I did, but then I  did exactly what you told me to do,  and I came right back.
You did. You're right.
Exactly. NICKY embraces her.
You did. I like that. I like that.  That's what I like about you. You  did the right thing.
(Playing with his  jacket) I did what you told me to.
Yes, you did.
'Cause you always tell me the right  thing to do.
Yeah. (Pause, with his arm  around her.) Boy, he really fucked himself up out  here - (She caresses his  face.) - didn't he?
Sure did.
Everything went to his head. (He sighs, rubbing  her neck.)
(In unison) Changed.
He did. He ain't the same person,  right?
(Whispering) No, he's not.
He really thinks who the fuck he is,  I'll tell you that.
(Holding back tears) Exactly. (Sighs.) He hates me. She rests her head on NICKY's shoulder, starting to weep.
He hates my fuckin' guts.
Come on, come on, you're a toughie.  You can take this. (Runs his hand down  her cheek.) Don't cry.
(Crying) I'm not as tough as you think I am.
Yes, you are.
(Sobbing) I'm not and he scares the shit out  of me. I never know what he's gonna  do.

(Softly, through tears) I need some help. I do. I need some  help. (Strokes his chest.) You gotta help me. I need a new  sponsor, Nicky. GINGER's sobs subside a little and her hand starts to str NICKY's neck.
(Whispering) I do. I need a new sponsor.
(Quietly, cheek to  cheek) Is that what you want?
Yeah.
A sponsor.
Yeah.
Mm... okay. Don't worry about it.  Nobody'll fuck with ya anymore.   I'll take care of ya.
(Whispering) Nicky, please...
Yes, I will. It's what you want,  isn't it? Huh?
(Sobbing) Thank you. Yeah, yeah, yeah.
It's what you want?

This is great for the boss.
GINGER gets into her car. Still photos: Click: GINGER getting into her car. Click:  NICKY getting into his car.
NICKY and GINGER drive off.

You know, I'm  in a restaurant and it's - it's  embarrassing. I don't want to do it  anymore. (Stopping suddenly.) Where's Amy?
I put her to bed.

With Jennifer.
And where'd you go?
To the Riviera.
(Pause) What'd you have?
I had a... salad.
What did Jennifer have?
(Turning to ACE) She had the same.
(Pause) Okay. I want you to call Jennifer  and I want you to tell her to tell  you what she had for lunch, and I'm  gonna listen in on the other line.
Why do you want to do that?
You know why I want to do it. Just  do it.
Fine. (Walking out and down  the hall.) Just gonna get the bowl for my thing.
Mm.
GINGER is on the hall phone, dialing. We hear a phone rin through the earpiece. She waits a few seconds and hangs up.
The line's busy. There's nobody there. She starts to walk away. ACE stops her, picks up the phon and dials. We hear JENNIFER answer.
(Over telephone) Hello.
(Into telephone) Hello, Jennifer, it's Sam - TIGHT ON GINGER'S FINGERS CUTTING OFF THE CALL.
All right... I didn't have lunch  with Jennifer.
(Hanging up) Who were you with?
(Quietly) I was with somebody.
I know you were with somebody. Who  was it? (Pause.) I just hope it's not someone who I  think it might be. (Sighs, then whispers:) I just hope it's not them.
(Quietly) I knew she fucked around. (Sighing.) You know...
The two of them are seated separately. GINGER is on the f leaning against a chair, crying softly.
...she did what she did and I did  what I had to do. But, Jesus, Nicky  was the worst thing she could've  done.
What if he won't stop?
I mean, it could get us both killed.
I can back him off. ACE sighs.
She was very convincing...

Who's this guy? Who's this guy?
Oh, he ain't nobody.
You know what I want you to do? Get  a couple of guys to dig a hole in  the desert, then let 'em show you  where it's at.
Angelo and Buster.

They'll do it.
And when I'm ready, I'll say the  words, 'Go see the Jew.'
Yeah.
And you make it disappear, you know  what I mean?
Yeah, just let me know. But you gotta  be ready. You know what I'm talkin'  about?
Did I say to do anything yet? I said  I'm not sure... I'll let you know. I  want to think about it. Where're  these pricks at? Looks for the FBI AGENTS.
Don't know.
Dominick said they're in the motel?
Yeah, either that or in the fuckin'  bank. I don't know. They're all over  the joint.

(Getting up from the  table) Be right back. I'll be right back. He walks over to RUDY, the maitre d'.
Rudy, any calls for me, just give  'em to Mr Sherbert. I'll be right  back.
Sure, Mr Rothstein. You'll be back...?
I'm going home for a few seconds.  I'll be right back. ACE hurries out. RUDY picks up the phone and dials a numb
(Into telephone) He's on his way home.
NICKY is on the phone. The place is jumping in the backgr
(Over telephone) Yeah, he just left.
Yeah? All right. He hangs up the phone and looks across the room at GINGER who is seated in a booth smiling at him and picking the o out of a Martini.
ACE gets home and can't find GINGER.
(Looking around the  house) Hello? Hello! Ginger.
(Faintly, from her  bedroom) Help, Daddy! Fear strikes him and he runs to his daughter's room.
(Knocking, turning  the doorknob) Amy! Amy, open the door!
(From her room) I can't! I'm tied!
Wh-wh - ACE slams his shoulder against the door, trying to knock down.
ACE forces it open and sees that AMY's arms have been tie to her bed with stockings. AMY screams.
Dad!
What happened? What happened? Who  did this to you?
Mommy.
I'm gonna get a knife and cut you  loose, honey, I'll -
(Panting) Oh, no, please, please. She tries to keep him from leaving her.
(Bending down, kisses  her) Okay, I'll be right back. ACE cuts AMY loose with a knife.
When did this happen, honey?
I don't know. She gets up and hugs her father.
You don't know? What time did your  mother do this? When did she leave?
I don't know.
(Comforting AMY as  she moans) Ohhh... He kisses her. They get up from the bed when the phone ri

(Into telephone) Hello.
(Over telephone) Sammy.
(Into telephone) Yeah, uh, who's this?
It's me.
(Into telephone) Nick?

(Into telephone) How'd you know I was here?
(Over telephone) Well...
DOMINICK and MARINO look on.
(Into telephone) ...uh, you know, I just wanted to  talk to you a minute.
(Over telephone) Well...

Listen to me, listen to me, listen  to me. (Pounding his fist on  the table.) Listen, you fuckin' cunt.
